abstract.text: A view that presents a list of nearby media receivers.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This view represents a button that users tap to stream audio/video content to a media receiver, such as a Mac or Apple TV.

When the user taps the button, the system presents a popover that displays all of the nearby AirPlay devices that can receive and play back media. If your app prefers video content, the system displays video-capable devices higher in the list.
In iOS 16 and later, you can add devices to the list that implement custom protocols. For more information about displaying third-party routes, see

content.text: Configure the button’s text, color, and media preference

inlineContent.text: The following code example creates the view alongside custom text:
Your app configures the button’s color scheme and indicates whether your app prefers video content, as the following code demonstrates:

code: // Indicate whether your app prefers video content.

abstract.text: Create user interfaces for media playback, complete with transport controls, chapter navigation, picture-in-picture support, and display of subtitles and closed captions.
Constants that indicate the audio route selection.
A view that presents a list of nearby media receivers.
Constants that describe the available button states.
The view’s tint color when AirPlay is active.
A routing controller that enables connections to non-AirPlay devices.
The delegate object for the route picker.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the route picker button has a border.
The player object to perform routing operations for.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the route picker sorts video output devices to the top of the list.
Returns the color of the picker button for the specified state.
The button style for the route picker.
Sets the route picker button color for the specified state.

media-4084052.alt: A screenshot of a popover with a list of items. The top item is an iPad icon with a check mark to the right. Below that is the title Speakers and TVs with a list of six subitems. The first subitem says Third-party device, followed by AirPlay and Third-party protocol. The remaining subitems are Sunset Beach with an Apple TV icon on the left, Link with TV code with a globe icon on the left, and Show more.

media-4084059.alt: A screenshot of an AV route picker view that composes a button with text that says Choose output device on the left, and an icon of a computer screen next to a set-top box remote on the right.
